issue.title: Starting bitcoin-qt with -nowallet and then opening a wallet does not show the wallet
issue.body: When starting bitcoin-qt with `-nowallet` to explicitly not load any wallets initially, attempting to load a wallet using the Open Wallet menu option results in the wallet being loaded but the GUI does not change. The wallet is reachable via the RPC interface but the GUI still says that no wallets are loaded.

events.body: Should tag with 0.18.
@achow101 I fail to reproduce, mind sharing more details, Qt version etc.
I tested this exact scenario in the PR that added the "open wallet" menu and it worked for me.
Also tested with #15450 and still works.

Bitcoin Core version v0.17.99.0-f9775a8655 (64-bit)
Qt version 5.7.1
Using Debian 9
I built it using the depends system and this bug is not present. It seems that the issue has to do with Qt 5.7.1.

Can confirm this issue. I compiled master inside a new Debian 9.8 vm (qt 5.7.1), a new wallet opened with the Open wallet menu doesn't display in the GUI.

![debian 9 8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/53143654-ec47a280-35d3-11e9-8774-e814218cbbda.gif)
@fanquake mind testing with same fix of #15455?
I've tried with that patch but it does not fix this.

I was not able to reproduce this, not on OSX self compiled master, not on Ubuntu 18.04.1 with a nightly build (gitian build of master) nor with self compiled master on Ubuntu (Qt 5.9.5). Either a timing issue or a Qt upstream difference.
My guess is that this is a QT 5.7 issue. @achow101 does it go away when you use the depends 5.9 version?
@Sjors yes, in IRC he said it works.
I'm working on a fix.
@promag mentioned [(line 197)](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-03-01.html) that #15478 is a potential fix for this issue.
Moving this to the [`0.18.1` milestone](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/milestone/41).
@fanquake care to test with #15478?
@promag is #16261 a potential fix for this?
@fanquake yes I think so.

Can confirm this bug on Debian 9.9 (Qt 5.7.1, master 8c69fae94410f54bad13be0f34d54370fddbf4b3).

debug.log:
```
...
2019-07-06T12:34:51Z GUI: QMetaMethod::invoke: Unable to handle unregistered datatype 'WalletModel*'
```

It seems the problem is here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8c69fae94410f54bad13be0f34d54370fddbf4b3/src/qt/walletcontroller.cpp#L118-L125

@fanquake I failed to build the Bitcoin Core with the [downloaded Qt 5.7.1](https://download.qt.io/archive/qt/5.7/5.7.1/) on bionic. Could you give me a piece of advice?
Fixed by #16348?
